text:
A damp haze clings to your skin as you descend. The stench becomes unbearable—the rot of centuries soaked into the land. You step into the marsh, where every footfall is a squelch of mud and something softer. Shadows move in the reeds. Eyes blink from hollows in trees twisted by time.

This is no natural swamp. The land itself resents your presence. Long-forgotten rituals echo here—fragments of prayers to gods that never answered. You must press forward, into the Weeping Marsh.
lore: The Weeping Marsh was once sacred to the Moss-Priests, keepers of rot and rebirth. But their prayers curdled when the Flame refused to die. They were swallowed by their own offerings.
